definition: to stir-fry/to do the cooking/stir-fried dish
to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: These red little Japanese plums add a perky taste to stir-frys and soups.
sentences.chinese: 这种红色的日本小李子在炒菜和放汤时，味道很带劲。

sentences.english: Pans are not as handy as works for Chinese cooking.
sentences.chinese: 做中国菜时，平底锅不如中式炒菜锅好用。

sentences.english: The oil is then put into big vats and used for cooking.
sentences.chinese: 榨出来的油就装在大桶子里，用来炒菜。

sentences.english: To eat plain rice or pasta without other dishes.
sentences.chinese: 他没有要炒菜，只吃白饭。
我的妈妈得到一只炒菜锅。

sentences.english: Every time I cook I use spice.
sentences.chinese: 我每次炒菜都要放八角茴香。

sentences.english: Pots and pans, woks as well.
Much of the food is fried and there is greater use of sesame oil and vinegar.
sentences.chinese: 沪菜中多数是炒菜，麻油和醋放得较多。

sentences.english: Heat 3 tbsp of the oil in a wok, and stir-fry the pork briefly. Remove.
sentences.chinese: 在炒菜锅中热3茶匙油，并简单炒下猪肉。

sentences.english: But this year, before they turned ripe, they were all picked by his neighbors for food.
sentences.chinese: 可今年，还没等丝瓜成熟，就被邻居们摘去炒菜了。
你炒菜，煎饼都用炒菜锅。
你炒菜，煎饼都用炒菜锅。

sentences.english: She turned the pancake over with her the spatula.
sentences.chinese: 她用炒菜铲子把这个松饼翻面。

sentences.english: You turn on the stove first, and pour some oil in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 炒菜前先打开炉子上的抽油烟机。

sentences.english: I ordered a dish of unmixed stir-fried cauliflower in the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我在餐馆点了一道清炒菜花。

sentences.english: The cook greased the pan before frying the vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 厨师炒菜前先在锅底涂上一层油。
